One darshan turned me from a borderline atheist to a devotee. That should tell you something. Let me explain my experience before I explain why this isn’t an unreasonable devotion.

Before I went to Tirumala, I was a Mumbai-girl with zero interest in religion. The only reason I wanted to go to Tirupati was because I needed to go on a trip and everyone in my family voted for Tirupati. When I first arrived, I found Tirumala to be unusually peaceful. Yes, there are crowds of devotees, but the air is clean, the environment is fresh, and the roads are clean. I loved that vibe.

One darshan turned me from a borderline atheist to a devotee. That should tell you something. Let me explain my experience before I explain why this isn’t an unreasonable devotion.

Before I went to Tirumala, I was a Mumbai-girl with zero interest in religion. The only reason I wanted to go to Tirupati was because I needed to go on a trip and everyone in my family voted for Tirupati. When I first arrived, I found Tirumala to be unusually peaceful. Yes, there are crowds of devotees, but the air is clean, the environment is fresh, and the roads are clean. I loved that vibe.

We had the darshan on the following day, but I was impressed by the scenery of the bright temple grounds nestled in the hills. That made the trip worth the effort.

Then I had the darshan. We stood in line for over five hours and the press of crowds was intense. I didn’t lose my patience or became angry with the close body contact with so many strangers. In fact, I had fun observing people from so many different walks of life.

When I entered the Sanctum, I forgot everything. I’m typically a little selfish and like to be happy and comfortable in my life. I would be the first to complain about long ques and two-second darshans, but I could see the Lord the moment I entered and He arrested me. All notions of asking Him for something or gaining a boon simply flew out of my head.

It was netra darshan that day so we could go close and His eyes were visible and not concealed by the namam. I am not an emotional or sentimental person so I was very surprised that I had tears in my eyes. I didn’t take my eyes off Him and got very close. At that point, I had only one prayer in my mind, guard my father if he is with you. My father had passed away over a year before this darshan. That was my most unselfish and pure wish. Nothing else came to my mind during the darshan but my father and my God.

People at Tirumala typically push devotees away to get them moving. I was pushed towards Him three times and they shouted at me to get proper darshan. I had. One single breath of contact with Him is more than enough. You don’t have to sit and stare at Him for hours. A single moment in His presence can fill you with powerful vibrations and cleanse you.

I came out of the temple, mind simply blown. The experience was astonishing and visceral, unlike anything I had ever gone through before.

Now, I try to visit Tirupati every year and every time I go, I feel all my work stress and pressure melt away. I don’t go there to get a wish granted or ask for boons. That’s a myth and selfishness. We’re asked to surrender, not demand. I surrendered. When I go there, my mind becomes blank and clean. The entire darshan experience is just a way to communicate with the God. I smile when I see Him, that hand gesturing towards his feet to surrender. I feel protected, welcome, and warm.

That’s the allure of Lord Venkateshwara. Of course, I have felt the same allure at every ancient Vishnu temple I have visited, but I can’t deny it’s there.

I still approach religion and practices with open eyes and a practical mindset, but there is a lot of solace in this.

People visit Tirupati for a number of reasons. Some want their wish granted, some believe the power of the God will cure their ills, some believe they must. Some are like me and go there just because they want to visit the God and bask in His presence. There’s nothing unreasonable about this. It’s an experience. It’s spirituality and devotion. This has the power to heal and help you recover from deep emotional pain.

Of course, if someone doesn’t have the spiritual clarity or an open mind, they can simply dismiss this as unreasonable. You have either not visited Tirumala and seen Him or you haven’t kept your mind open. People who get frustrated about Tirupati often let the press of crowd and long ques overwhelm their experience. They keep complaining about the long wait, the exhaustion, and don’t experience the energy and vibrations generated by thousands of devotees.

The simple fact is, unless you experience it yourself, you won’t understand it and you’ll keep calling it unreasonable devotion.

Word of advice, don’t bash it without trying it. People do experience something when they go to Tirumala. If you don’t, it’s on you, buddy, not on the God or the temple. He is open to everyone but not everyone is open to Him.

Because of the history and divinity associated with it. Trust me you will never find a single Telugu person who never visited Tirupati in his/her life. The popular assumption is that the Venkateshwara swamy idol in Tirupati is swayambu (self born) and it is the place where Lord Vishnu placed his foot in Kali Yuga. This is the reason why lakhs of devotees visit Tirupati everyday.

There are many legends behind the history of Tirupati.

  1. Once Bhu Devi requested Lord Vishnu that she is not able to bear the weight of sinners on the Earth in Kali Yuga and to protect the Earth from the sinners. To which,

Because of the history and divinity associated with it. Trust me you will never find a single Telugu person who never visited Tirupati in his/her life. The popular assumption is that the Venkateshwara swamy idol in Tirupati is swayambu (self born) and it is the place where Lord Vishnu placed his foot in Kali Yuga. This is the reason why lakhs of devotees visit Tirupati everyday.

There are many legends behind the history of Tirupati.

  1. Once Bhu Devi requested Lord Vishnu that she is not able to bear the weight of sinners on the Earth in Kali Yuga and to protect the Earth from the sinners. To which, Lord Vishnu assured Bhu Devi (Goddess Earth) that he will stay on the Earth for entire Kali Yuga to protect her. He choose the 7 hills of Tirupati as his abode , this is the reason why Tirupati is called Bhu Loka Vaikunta. Acoording to Varaha Purana, Venkateshwara swamy will reincarnate as Kalki at the end of Kali Yuga from the Tirupati Balaji idol.
  2. The another legend says, the foster mother of Sri Krishna Yashoda Devi was sad for not witnessing anyone of Krishna’s marriages and complains the same to Lord Krishna. To which, Lord Krishna promised her that she will get the opportunity to witness his marriage in Kali Yuga. Hence in Kali Yuga, Lord Krishna incarnated as Venkateshwara in Tirupati, Goddess Lakshmi as Padmavati in Tiruchanur near to Tirupati and Yashoda Devi as Vakula Devi who later became foster mother to Lord Venkateshwara. As per the divine plan, Venkateshwara and Padmavati fell in Love and married eachother infront of Vakula Devi. It was said that Lord Venkateshwara had taken a loan of 15 million Rama mudrika gold coins from Kubera for his grand marriage and promised him that he would repay the loan with interest by the end of Kali Yuga. This is because Padmavati devi was born in rich & royal family whereas Venkateshwara swamy chooses to be poor. Their marriage happened on the 7 hills of Tirupati and all Gods (Shiva, Brahma,Ganesha, Karthikeya, etc….) attended the Lord’s wedding. Vakula devi witnessed what she wished. After the marriage, Lord Venkateshwara and Padmavati Devi spent several years on the 7 hills of Tirupati. This is why Tirupati got another name Bhu Loka Vaikunta.

This is the reason why many devotees flock to Tirupati . It is the world’s most visited pilgrimage site and no wonder it is the richest temple in the world.

Tirupati Venkateshwara swamy temple

Goddess Padmavathi temple Tiruchanur

Vakula Maata Temple (Foster mother of venkateshwara swamy)

So, when you visit Tirupati You make sure that you first visit Padmavati devi temple in Tiruchanur ( 10 KM from Tirupati) first and then visit Vakula Mata Temple and finally visit the Lord Venkateshwara swamy Temple.

Om Namo Venkateshaya

Well Thirumala or Thirumalai Temple is very famous and is regarded as the richest temple in the world that receives donations

Why didn’t any other temple took this place while Thirumala could do this and its all because of Faith!!! Beleif!!! Trust!!! but there are some cultural and historical reasons too and let’s look at those.

Thirumala!

Of the devotees who visit a lot to Thirumala-Most of them come from 4 states-Andhra Pradesh ,Telangana, Tamil Nadu and Karnataka and some from Kerala, Maharashtra and Goa.

With the word of mouth from past 20 years even Northern Indians have started to visit this temple when they do a temple tour in Southern India.

For the people of Andhra and Telangana , their main and most important God is Lord Venkateshwara and thus many Telugites keep on taking yathra to Thirupathi every year.

I have seen Telugites going crazy over Balaji and having said that they name their children with many names of Lord Balaji and even they visit the temple on a regular basis.-Many Telugites have Lord Balaji has their home God and thus its compulsory to have the darshan their home God temple every year.

Historically this temple got so much patronage from Vijayanagar kings and queens(and by many other Telugu kings like Aravidu dynasty) and thus Thirupathi temple is very famous among Telugites.

Background of Telugu marriages, they always have a Thirupathi Balaji photo or replica.


For the people of Tamil Nadu, Lord Perumal is the 3rd most famous God after Murugan and Lord Shiva. Many families have Lord Perumal as their home God and its important to visit the temple atleast once a year.

Also historically the temple was built by Pandyas and the the Tamil kingdoms like Cholas ,Pandyas have given many donations.( Also the story of Thirumalai is connected to the Sangam Cholas).

Also its said that Thirupathi and Thirumala is mentioned as “Thiru Vengadam” in Tamil literature and was considered as the ancient border village between the Tamilakam region and the Vadugar region(Andhra region).-Thirupathi is just 56 km from the nearest TN border and hence Tamil devotees easily feel connection to the temple.

Also the temple is easily accesscible from eastern and Southern side as west and northern side has thick mounatins and forests.

This temple gets mention as one of the important 108 Divya Desams by Alwars and the pontiffs who maintain this temple are from both Tamil region and Andhra region(who were appointed by Ramanujacharya in the past , again a Tamilakam Telugite).

Certain hymns in Tamil from Divya Prabhandam is also chanted as the temple has Tamil priests.


Kannadigas sweetly call Lord Balaji as “Thimappa” there are so many meanings to this name like- strong personality, one who has magical abilities and great creative skills.

If you ask any Kannadiga “where you went?” after they go and come back from Thirupathi , they say “Thimmapanannu darshana maadi bande”-”I went to have the Darshan of Thimappa”

Again Vijayanagar and other Karnataka empires gave a lot of patronage to the temple and even many Kannadigas have a norm of visiting the temple atleast once a year.


Common things for these 3 cultural people.

Kannadigas, Teliugus and Tamils have two month dedicated to the worship of Lord Venkateshwara- That is Shravana or Purattasi and the Saturdays in this month is dedicated to the worship of Lord Balaji in their homes by offering him food and making his Tilak on the forehead.(Saavan in Northern India is dedicated to Shiva but here in South it's for Vishnu)

The month of Dhanur or Maargazhi is also dedicated to the worship of Perumaal where Thirupathi priests recite the Thirupaavai( hymn of Aandal) in Tamil instead of Suprabatham which is in Sankskrit.

Then all these 4 state people dedicate a Hundi where they save money and take that money to Thirumala and offer it to him.( This money is put into the Hundiion every Sarturdays ).

There are many things that people donate to Thirupathi like many people from these 4 states donate lands to Thirupathi.

Sandalwood for Thirumala foes from Karnataka.

Name some of the facts about Tirumala Balaji Temple?

Thanks for A2A

  • Kaccha Karpooram (Green Camphor), which is a soft white chemical is applied on the idol of Balaji every day. Actually, if this chemical is applied on a granite stone, cracks will appear on it. Surprisingly, this is applied on Balaji every day but there is no damage to the idol.
  • There is a secret village, approximately 23 Kms from the temple in Tirumala, where no one is allowed except the residents of the village. Lord Venkateswara gets all the flowers, milk, ghee, butter from this village only.
  • It is also said one can hear the sound of water waves from the back of the idol

Thanks for A2A

  • Kaccha Karpooram (Green Camphor), which is a soft white chemical is applied on the idol of Balaji every day. Actually, if this chemical is applied on a granite stone, cracks will appear on it. Surprisingly, this is applied on Balaji every day but there is no damage to the idol.
  • There is a secret village, approximately 23 Kms from the temple in Tirumala, where no one is allowed except the residents of the village. Lord Venkateswara gets all the flowers, milk, ghee, butter from this village only.
  • It is also said one can hear the sound of water waves from the back of the idol
  • Though Lord Venkateshwara statue appears to be standing at the center but, actually, Swamy stands at the right side corner of the Garba Gudi.
  • The oil lamps lighted in front of the Swamy idol are said to be lit since thousands of years. It is also said that the lights never extinguish.
  • There is also a traditional belief that Balaji has a third eye which he opens at the time of Abhishekam. Daily the third eye is closed by the Kachcha Karpuram.
  • There is also a belief that Lord Venkateswara and Mata Lakshmi roams in the Tirumala Mada streets in the human form at evening.
  • During Bramhotsavam, when Garuda Seva is performing, then Garuda (eagle) comes to watch the utsav. I and my father witnessed it once.

What are some strange but interesting facts about Tirupati Balaji?

Manohar is an young Auditor from the city of Hyderabad who got married to his school time friend, Archana, on one auspicious day, some time during the summer of 2008.

After the marriage, Manohar, who is a big devotee of Lord Venkateswara, wanted to go on a visit to the Tirumala hills, along with his newly wedded wife, and seek the divine blessings of his favorite Lord.

Accordingly, he had kept all the travel plans scheduled much in advance and had also made guest house reservations for their comfortable stay on the Tirumala hills..

Although young, Manohar is a successful Auditor, so getting accommodation on the hills and seva tickets for the Kalyanotsavam was not a big deal for him for the amount of clientele he has in the aristocratic circles of Hyderabad.

Even otherwise, Manohar is a perfectionist to the core and would plan all the things on his own, much in advance .. He firmly believes that everything in life, whether big or small, should be planned way ahead of time.

He further believes and also quite arrogantly keeps telling all his fiends and colleagues that,

“The journey of life should always go smooth and there should never be any inconvenience in life either to us or to those associated with us.. Life is not for the lazy or unplanned people but is only for the well prepared and successful people like me.

Of course I believe in God but I believe more in my preparedness and my capabilities.. As long as am so well equipped in life there can never be any inconvenience to me or to my family.. And why should there be any, when am so cautious in my approach towards life”

Uffff.. How sick and boring some people can be.. Manohar is just a personification of arrogance.. However, what the poor Manohar was not aware at that stupid moment of his life was,

“Above all, that is visible to the human eye today, there’s One sitting there in an invisible mode, and watching everything that His creation does on this planet.. It is not we who plan everything in our life but it is he Who does that for us, much before placing us in our Mother’s womb” PERIOD

Therefore, Lord Venkateswara – with an intention to teach Manohar a lesson for his arrogance and also to make him realize that there’s nothing that anyone in this world can really earn on their own, unless it is there in the divine scheme of things – had designed the following drama, on the Tirumala hills, using the most popular Indian Superstar yet the most humble devotee called Rajinikanth, as a pivotal character in the drama.

In a way, through this incident – that occurred on the Tirumala ghat road during the darkest hours of night – Lord Venkateswara had proved to Manohar that he’s just a nobody in this gigantic universe.

Please Continue Reading..

Gateway To Tirumala Hills Near Alipiri Point

After arriving at the Tirupati airport, Manohar and his wife Archana headed straight to the Tirumala hills, in a special Car arranged by one of his clients.. In the evening, they went for the normal darsan of Lord Sri Venkateswara.

Next morning, the newly married couple attended the Kalyanotsavam..

Even during the sacred procedure of Kalyanam, Manohar went about boring his wife telling her how hard he worked during his student days to achieve his dream of becoming an Auditor and how popular he’s currently among his clients and how smartly he gets their works done.

What can any lady in Archana’s position, during such embarrassing moments, would say except faking a smile with a common thought every woman normally gets about men during such moments.. “Men are men”..

Archana was doing the same that moment, of course, still silently offering her prayers to the divine couple of Lord Venkateswara and Smt. Pdamavati to grant them that much desired eternal marital bliss in their life.

After all, it is with that desire that any couple would perform the Kalyanotsavam to the Lord in Tirumala Temple.. Right..??.

After the Kalyanotsavam,

Both Manohar and Archna had one more round of darsan of Lord Venkateswara at the Garbha Griha of the Tirumala Temple. Later, after having a sumptuous meal at one of the finest restaurants on the Tirumala hills, they both went to their guest house and relaxed in the afternoon.

In the evening, both went for a walk on the pleasant Tirumala hills and went about buying a few gifts for their respective family members.. After that, they had another round of lovely dinner at another luxurious restaurant on the hills..

After the dinner, Manohar once again called the private Car owner, whom he hired to take them straight to Chennai, that night.. His plan was to go straight to Chennai from Tirupati and spend a couple of days there with his paternal aunt and then return to Hyderabad.

During that telephonic conversation, Manohar told the owner in a commanding tone, “We should at any cost leave from our guest house at 11.25 p.m to night.. Because the ghat road will be closed between 12 pm and 3 am.. So if we can start at 11.25 we can go down before 12..

From there we can reach Chennai by early morning.. If we cannot reach Chennai before that time, then traffic begins on the roads and we will have to spend a lot of time in Car.. I don’t want that inconvenience at any cost.. So ask your driver to be at my guest house by sharp 11.15.. Is that clear Mr.Subrahmanyam..”

The poor Subrahmanyam said “yes” and disconnected the call..

Later, Manohar and Archana returned to their room and relaxed for a while.. From 10 pm, Manohar started hurrying up his wife to get ready.. When she said, ” there’s time”, he rudely replied to her saying, “what if we are ready half an hour in advance instead of being late by half an hour..

That’s the problem with all our Indians .. We don’t have time sense.. That’s why we are lagging behind in many matters.. See Americans.. How well they maintain their time. Hence, they are way ahead of us and we are still in times of British.”

Without uttering a word, Archana not only got ready but also kept the entire luggage ready by 10.45 pm.. From there on, Manohar started waiting for the driver and called him at least five times to make sure that he is reaching the guest house by 11.15 p.m.

Finally, the poor driver reached the guest house by 11.15 p.m..

Manohar asked the driver to first put their luggage in the boot area of the Car.. Later, he sat in the Car and noted down the meter reading and then checked the functioning of the A C in the Car.

After making sure that everything was perfect in the Car, Manohar called his wife outside..

Then he stood along with her on the entrance steps of the guest house; turned towards the Tirumala Hills; and silently offered his prayers to Lord Venkateswara, for a couple of minutes..

Later, loudly telling his wife “Punar darsana praptirastu”, Manohar boarded the car, along with her, and exactly at 11.25 p.m, the Car left the guest house and headed towards the exit gate of the Tirumala hills.

After a few minutes of silence in the car, Manohar turned to his wife and said,

“This is how I schedule any program in my life and this is how I mange my time table… Time management is an art very few people in the world cultivate.. Fortunately, your husband is one among them.. So, sweetheart, the summary is, I want everything in life to be perfect including you”..

Archana just smiled.. Poor Manohar was not aware that moment that all his principles of life and about life are going for a toss in a few minutes and through one most horrifying experience, Lord Venkateswara is going to teach him the harshest lesson of his life that will completely change his outlook towards life, wife, people, profession and society.. PERIOD

After A Few Minutes Of Silent Journey,

The great cosmic drama in the life of Manohar had begun..

And this was how it all began..

After crossing the exit gate, the Car entered the Tirumala ghat road..

Later, while taking a steep turn downwards, on the darkness filled ghat road, all the three in the Car first heard a loud blasting sound.

Before, they could even know what that sound was and where it came from, the Car first started going down rapidly with multiple jerks and then started quickly rolling down uncontrollably..

The shocked driver just was unable to know what to do..

However, he still composed himself and realized that something had seriously gone wrong with his Car.. Then slowly applying the brakes, using the hand brake lever, the sensible driver finally managed to bring the Car to a halting position.

Manohar and Archana were in a frozen state..

Slowly regaining normalcy, they stepped out of the Car and were shocked to notice that not only the rear wheel Tyre of their Car had blasted but also the Car went and almost knocked the wall that was built alongside the ghat road as a protection to prevent vehicles from slipping off accidentally into the valley.

After remaining in a shocking silence for a couple of minutes, assessing the whole situation, Manohar slowly turned to the driver and said,

“Looks like the wheel went over a sharp stone and got busted.. It’s okay.. Such things happen.. Lord Venkateswara saved our Car from slipping off into the valley.. Now quickly remove the spare wheel and fix it to the Car.

It’s a jungle area and is also very dark here.. It is also time for the wild animals to come out into open for roaming.. We will sit in the Car.. Finish off your job quickly and fix the spare wheel.. We should move from this jungle at the earliest”.

Saying so Manohar turned back to enter into the car.. Freezing Manohar again, the driver replied in a low tone,” Sorry Sir.. There’s no spare wheel in the Car.. Gave it for a repair in the morning”.

“Whattttt…???..” screamed Manohar..

Scratching his head, the driver replied,”Yes sir.. The spare wheel tube has a problem.. So I gave it in the repairing shop to replace it.. The shop is on our way in downtown Tirupati .. And it will be open round the clock.. Thought we can get it fixed on the way to Chennai once we are down the hills.. This problem I didn’t expect.. Sorry Sir”.

Almost pouncing upon him, Manohar shouted at him non stop for a full three minutes.. Unable to bear with the filthy language her well learned husband was using at that time, while abusing that poor hapless driver, Archana closed her ears.

Finally, the driver interrupted Manohar’s free flow of abusive language and said in a slightly angered tone,

“Sir, mind your language.. What can I do if tyre goes busted.. It is for Lord Venkateswara to protect His devotees.. You are in His kingdom so it is for Him now to protect you. How do I know what you did and why is He is punishing you like this”.

Screaming furthermore loudly, Manohar almost jumped on the driver.. Archana quickly came between the two and pulled Manohar back saying,

“Control yourself Manohar.. What can this poor fellow do if such unforeseen things happen.. As he said, Lord Venkateswara gave this problem so it is for Him to provide the solution.. Let us sit in the Car and wait and see if any other vehicle comes down now”..

Still fretting and fuming, Manohar told Archana,”The ghat road is closed from 12 am to 3 am in the night.. It’s almost 1’o clock now.. So no vehicles will come now.. Until 3 we just have to sit in the car and wait.. In the meantime, if no animal munches us we will survive otherwise Govindaa Gooovindaa”.

Saying so, Manohar went and sat in the car.. The driver then turned to Archana and said,

“Ammaa.. Listen to me.. There won’t be signals here so our mobiles will not be working.. Except waiting in the car, until the ghat road is again open, there’s nothing much that we can do now..

We can neither go up nor go down walking.. It is also too dangerous to do so, as many wild animals like the wild Boars, Wolves and Civet Cats will be freely roaming around this time.. Please sit in the Car.. Luckily if any emergency vehicle comes, I shall stop it.. At least you both can go”.

Left with nothing else to do, Archana silently went and sat in the Car.. The driver just stood outside, quietly watching the eight elements of Nature..

And Then..

Seconds started turning into minutes and minutes into an hour but there was no sign of any emergency vehicle coming from the upward direction..

The howling of the Wolves from a distance and the meowing of the Cats nearby combined with pitch darkness all around was making the night miserable for both Manohar and Archana..

Unable to bear with the fear of darkness and with the sounds of animals all around, Manohar slowly started cursing Lord Venkateswara,

“What is this Swamy.. I have been your devotee since my childhood and came all the way with my newly married wife to seek your blessings and is this what you are doing to me now..

Not correct Swamy.. Not correct.. Not sure whether we will be survive this night or not.. And if we do I don’t know about my wife but I shall never come to your Tirumala Hills again Swamy.. Nevverrrr..”

On the contrary, Archana closed her eyes and was silently reciting “Sri Venkateswara Vajra Kavacham” which she had learned in her childhood..

Time was moving slowly for them in that darkness; on that night; in that jungle; and on that sacred Tirumala Hills..

Exactly At About 2.33 A.M

The driver first saw the head lights of a Car coming from a distance form the upward direction.. Hurriedly getting up from the rock he was thus far sitting, he quickly came on to the road to stop that Car.

At the same time, Manohar too heard the horn sound of that Car.. He immediately jumped out of the Car.. Looking at Manohar the Driver said,”Sir looks like some TTD vehicle or a VIP is coming with a special permission.. I will stop the Car.. Be ready..”

Saying so, the driver went and stood in the middle of the ghat road and started signalling, with a Namaskar pose, to the speedily coming Car to stop.. The Car came zooming in but slowed down it’s speed on approaching the driver standing in the middle of the road..

The driver went running to the driver seat of that Car and explained him everything and requested him to drop them in Tirupati.. That driver turned his head back and told the same to his ‘Boss’ sitting in the Car.. The ‘Boss’ said something..

That driver then told this driver, “Boss said ok.. We are any how going to Chennai.. They can directly come with us to Chennai.. Boss says, “newly married couple should not have any problems..”.. Ask your customers to come and board the Car.. You bring the luggage and put it behind..”

Mnaohar and Archana literally danced with joy..Thanking Lord Venkateswara, they got down from the Car..

At the same time the ‘Boss’ stepped out of his Car and quietly bending his head went and sat in the front seat of his Car, beside his driver, just to accommodate the newly married couple in the rear seat.

Blaming the driver and refusing him to pay him his money for troubling them so much on that night, Manohar quite thanklessly went and sat inside the Car.. The hapless driver could not say anything as the Car carrying Manohar and Archana left for Chennai..

Since it was too dark that night and as they were also so tensed up, neither Manohar nor Archana could notice that great man who had come as a “savior” sent by holy Lord Venkateswara..

In a few minutes all the three of them slipped into a deep sleep.

At About 6 A.M

The Car carrying the ‘Boss’, Manohar and Archana entered the city of Chennai.. After going a little distance into Chennai, the ‘Boss’ said some thing to the driver in Tamil and in a low tone..

The driver then told Manohar, “Sir.. If it is okay with you we shall first drop my ‘Boss’ at his residence and then I shall drop you wherever you want me to drop.. That is what my ‘Boss’ is saying.. Is that okay with you sir”.

“”Certainly okay.. ” a fully beaming Manohar said.. Then turning his head towards the ‘Boss’, who at that time was looking at the empty streets of his beloved Chennai city, Manohar said, “thank you very much sir”.

Without turning his head back, the ‘Boss’ silently raised his right hand and pointing it towards a Diamond studded small black colored statue of Lord Venkateswara, that is there on the front side of his car said,’thank him”.

After about a few minutes,

Superstar Rajinikanth

The Car entered a luxurious house in Chennai city.. On halting the Car, the driver quickly came running to the other side of the Car to open the door for his ‘Boss’.. The ‘Boss’ majestically stepped out of the Car.

Manohar and Archana too quickly stepped out of the Car to thank that gentleman who had so generously brought them to Chennai.. Firstly, they saw an elderly salt and pepper bearded man with a bald head and with a Silk Shawl draped around the upper portion of his body..

It was a second later when ‘Boss’ turned and came close to them, that both Manohar and Archana felt jerks in their body as though affected by an electric shock.. It was a shock of their life for them..

The man whom they have grown up admiring ; the man who is the darling of millions of Indians living all over the world; the favorite star of all the Indian film stars; and the super star among all the Indian superstars – the great Rajinikanth is standing like a smple man in front of them..

Manohar and Archana just couldn’t believe their eyes.. They quickly bent down and touched his feet.. Lifting them up, the Thalaivar said, “God bless you my dears.. I came to Tirumala for a quick darsan and was coming back to attend a shooting in the morning in Chennai.. Met you on the way.. Am His devotee first and Rajinikanth next.

Whatever you all think am today is entirely due to His blessings.. So I often go to His Tirumala Temple to offer my prayers and my sincere thanks to Him for making me what am today.. Otherwise who am I.. If He desires He can make a bus conductor a superstar and a superstar a bus conductor..

If you all think or if I think that I have earned this status with my own efforts then it is wrong.. Many people put many efforts in their life but how many people attain the status that only a few in India have so far attained..

Unless blessed by Him, nothing moves in this world.. I don’t know who you are and what you do young man, but do well in life.. But always be humble and be thankful to Him for all that you have so far achieved in life or you would be achieving in your future..

Be soft spoken.. Be kind to people.. Do all that you can do to your fellow beings.. While there are only a few people who are really earning well in this world, there are millions who are starving.. So help them.. That makes God more happy because He is present more among them than in us.. Hands that serve are more powerful than the lips that pray..

I saw you shouting on that Driver and coming into my Car without paying him his money.. How is that poor fellow responsible for what had happened in your life.. By giving you this problem God is trying to convey something to you.

Read the signals and read that message and change the way you are treating life now.. He gave you the problem but He had also given you the solution through me.. Right..??.. Otherwise why would my journey get delayed when I was supposed to leave Tirumala at 11.30 pm..

My Car too had a problem and it took time for it to get rectified.. May be He delayed my program because I have to come to your rescue.. Always look at life the way I explained you, then all the happiness in this world is yours..

You must be having that driver’s number.. Call him immediately and make him happy by collecting his bank account details and credit the money to his account.. If possible send a thousand more.. It may not be a big amount to you but is certainly for him.. Good luck”.

Then turning to Archana, the great superstar Rajinikanth said, “Ammaa.. Glad that I could be of some help to a newly married couple like you that too on the sacred Tirumala hills.. May you both have a wonderful married life.. Now promise me that you both will manufacture a Cricket team for me in future.. Hahahahaa”

Love

How is LPU's School of Architecture and Design grooming graduate architects?

In an era of smart cities, sustainable buildings, and contemporary interiors, graduates of the LPU School of Architecture and Design (LSAD) are groomed to become lateral thinkers by focusing on the critical design approach. LSAD is emerging as a global center of “Excellence for Learning, Research, and Engagement” in Architecture, Design, and Planning. With exposure to an international environment, and access to the latest tools, software, and technology, our students become architects who create buildings and infrastructure which are globally acknowledged. In an era of smart cities, sustainable buildings, and contemporary interiors, graduates of the LPU School of Architecture and Design (LSAD) are groomed to become lateral thinkers by focusing on the critical design approach. LSAD is emerging as a global center of “Excellence for Learning, Research, and Engagement” in Architecture, Design, and Planning. With exposure to an international environment, and access to the latest tools, software, and technology, our students become architects who create buildings and infrastructure which are globally acknowledged. LSAD is a leading institution in terms of quality education and is ranked among the top ten promising architecture institutes of India by the Higher Education Review.

LPU School of Architecture & Design has been ranked as 12th in Architecture & Design in India in NIRF 2022 rankings. LPU School of Architecture Design has also been ranked as top 6 Architecture Design institutes in India by Outlook Magazine. LPU is one of the only 3 Indian universities in the list of Top 100 universities of the world as per the prestigious Times Higher Education Impact Rankings 2022. LPU is also ranked 23rd amongst all universities in India in the latest World University Rankings 2023.

Grab the opportunity to study at LSAD. Apply here.

Factors that have propelled LPU and LSAD to the top league of Indian Architecture and Design institutions are discussed below.

Accreditation and Membership: LSAD has the approval of the Council of Architecture, the statutory body of the Government of India. LSAD is a member of the Indian Institute of Architects Punjab Chapter, an Institutional member of the Indian National Trust for Art and Cultural Heritage (INTACH), the National Association of Students of Architecture (NASA), Member of the National Organization of Students of Planning (NOSPLAN), and associated with Indian Green Building Council (IGBC) Student Chapter as well.

Curriculum: Use contemporary technology as well as a modern teaching aid. The curriculum incorporates knowledge-based and skill-based pedagogies to enable students to become industry-ready professionals.

Hands-on Experience: LSAD believes in ‘Experiential Learning’, which is an effective technique of teaching involving hands-on experience. Students develop knowledge, skills, and values through direct experiences in workshops, study tours, site visits, internships with top architects, and more.

Partnership with international Institutions: LSAD has articulation arrangements with foreign universities like Curtin University (Australia), and Swinburne University of Technology (Australia). For international exposure, students have the opportunity to go for 4 weeks study tour to USA/ European countries.

Grab the opportunity to study at LSAD. Apply here.

Industry Interface: LSAD believes in the strong industry connection marked by collaboration and regular interaction with senior industry professionals. LSAD has signed MoU with Smart Habitat Foundation, New Delhi for organizing seminars, events, workshops, and research with ASSOCHAM council for Green and Eco-friendly Movement (GEM). Industry professionals also regularly participate in the Board of Studies for curriculum review and capstone project evaluation to ensure that the academic output is as per industry standards.

Interaction with the leading architects of the world

World-renowned industry experts in the field of Architecture, Design, and Planning have been regularly interacting with students, including stalwarts like Ar. Raj Rewal (Director, Raj Rewal Associates), Dr. DS Meshram (President, Institute of Town Planners, India), Ar. Matthew Taylor (Director, Taylor Brammer Landscape Architects, Australia), Ms. Paola Martini (Designer from Italy), Dr. Arlene M Plevin (Professor, Olympic College, Washington, USA), Scott B. Knox (Architect from the USA), Dr. Hamish Rennie from New Zealand, Dr. Zebun (Professor, Dept. of Architecture, University of Engineering and Technology, Bangladesh), Ar. Plainda Kannangara (Principal Architect at Palinda Kannangara Architects, Sri Lanka), Dr. Madhusudan Pal (Scientist-F, DIPAS, DRDO, New Delhi), Ar. Krishnanrao Jaisim Rao (Director, Fountain Head), Charanjit Singh Shah (Director, Creative Group).

Faculty with global experience

LSAD has a team of experienced faculty members possessing national and international qualifications with a specialized background in Sustainable Architecture, Urban Design, Urban Planning, Environment Planning, and Industrial Planning.

Focus on Entrepreneurship

At LSAD, we help students build the skills and competencies which are necessary to be successful entrepreneurs. They are guided to not only create new designs and buildings but also to respect the social, cultural, emotional, legal, physical, and economic parameters along with innovative and functionally meaningful design solutions.

Placement Support: Apart from rigorous curricular inputs, students at LSAD are thoroughly prepared for industry placements through training in soft skills, communication skills, aptitude skills, and industry analysis. Architecture students of LSAD are placed for internships and placements in top national and international companies like Qatar Design Consortium, Benz & Ziegler, US-based company Dharam Consulting, Architect Hafeez Contractor, DLF Building India, Atkins, DP Architects, Design Forum, TERI, PVR Cinemas, Didi Contractor, Cosford, Abha Narain Lambah Associates, Sanjay Puri Architects, Wagma Designs, CP Kukreja, Design Forum International and many others.

Admission to LPU for the 2023 intake has already begun. The Admission process is quite competitive and is based on students clearing the university’s entrance test LPUNEST2023 and personal interview in a few courses. The last date to submit the application form is closing soon. To know more about the exam & admission process, students can apply here.

What are the miracles of Tirupati Balaji temple?

I have heard a lot of stories about the miracles of Tirupati Balaji. I will share here my experience of miracles.

I had known about Sreevari seva of Tirupati, when I was in a tough situation, I had asked wish that I will come and do seva for 7 days.

[Photo source internet]

Then I went to Sreevari seva,

  1. We have to submit a letter to register, which is from the ttd site, I was not aware about this, they asked for this, since registration was done 3 months prior and password was saved in my laptop, so I don’t remember properly

I have heard a lot of stories about the miracles of Tirupati Balaji. I will share here my experience of miracles.

I had known about Sreevari seva of Tirupati, when I was in a tough situation, I had asked wish that I will come and do seva for 7 days.

[Photo source internet]

Then I went to Sreevari seva,

  1. We have to submit a letter to register, which is from the ttd site, I was not aware about this, they asked for this, since registration was done 3 months prior and password was saved in my laptop, so I don’t remember properly
    1. I tried login couple of times requesting them in their computer, tried 2 combinations, did not work.
    2. Called my sister, my sister and brother-in-law were trying to login from Bangalore, as my mobile net was not good there. They tried 10–15 combinations which I asked, nothing worked.
    3. They tried to reset password 20 times around, my mobile has correct signal, but did not receive the message.
    4. I went to a cyber there and started trying to login and reset password, all same no message and invalid password.
    5. I am alone, at night 11:30PM around, roaming in an unknown place. (this was first time I came out somewhere alone)
    6. I was terrified, I had no other way to go, I had to login and register there to even stay somewhere that night.
    7. This all process was around 3 hours, I had courage and hope, by now, I am almost broke, eyes are filled. Donno what to do.
    8. This is when I was like god, “I donno what to do, I have no other way to go if it did not login in” with eye full of tears and tried again with the same password, IT LOGGED IN.
  2. On my first day of seva, I was so excited, it was starting from 8:00 AM, they told better to go at 7:30 AM, So by 7 AM I am ready with red and orange dress, I started walking reached around 7:30 AM.
    1. Since it was first day and at 7:00 AM I started, I had no idea, I need to have breakfast and come.
    2. Work started, It was in ladoo distribution counter, loosing the ladoo from tray and distributing the ladoo.
    3. I was exited, it was going great, it is easy but we will distribute 1000s of ladoos so it requires continues work and energy.
    4. By 11, I am already seeing starts, very tired no energy.
    5. My duty is till 2:00 PM, I am thinking, not able to standup even, how i will work till 2:00 PM
    6. The ladoo distribution counter will be closed room, with door locked from inside.
    7. Now a lady comes, she looks in the small gap of the door and calls me and ask to open door, I asked room manager and opened door.
    8. She asked the room manager that she wants to take me out for some time. He agreed and sent me.
    9. I don’t know who she is and where we are going, I am walking with her, she took me to kitchen of the temple where food gets prepared and sent to many places.
    10. She took me to milk boiling room, and got me a glass of milk. I drank without speaking a word.
    11. Then she took me to other room, and asked me if I had breakfast, I said no, she said you should have and come from tomorrow, and got me a plate of curd-rice, I gobbled.
  3. This was last day of my seva, it was to distribute coffee and breakfast for those who will be waiting in rooms. It was starting at 5:30 AM in morning.
    1. It was on monday, so I was on fast, for lord Shiva Shankar :) I had taken few bananas to eat.
    2. Distribution of coffee done and distribution of breakfast was also done by 7:30 and I also ate all 3 fruits by then.
    3. Now no more distribution, but since my duty is till 11:00 I need to stay. I was staying in that room itself.
    4. Since its monday, I wanted to do lord Shiva puja, as I use to do puja every monday when I was at home, but in tirupati only Balaji we can see everywhere, no other gods, (actually I am a hard core fan of Krishna, so first day, when i went for shopping wanted to find a locked of krishna for my chain, almost roamed every place did not find, ppl told we will not find any-other god here, only Balaji)
    5. I started singing shiva songs, in few minutes the TV in the front room was turned on by someone and it started showing shiva linga abhisheka, aarati, I was stunned.
    6. I was hungry as well, there was upma which I was distributing, but I cannot eat as I am on fast and fruits also got over.
    7. There comes few 5–6 women from maharastra, who also came for seva, deputed to the same room, and they also fast on monday, so they had kept lot of dry fruits with them, they told we can have dry fruits in monday fast, and shared it with me.

Many many more such miracles I had experienced in those 7 days.

God is great and Miracles happen :)

It might look very normal or simple here, but in that moment I could feel it was a miracle and not co-incidence.

Let god bless everyone who read this :)

Let god bless more to those who had patience to read completely :D

Edukondalavada Venkataramana Govinda Govinda !!!!!!

With Love & Respect

Because of miracles like to these which I'm going to share with you friends…

Please read this real life incident it till the end, this incident is taken from the book “Naham Karta" written by TTD Chief Executive Officer Sri Prasad who later became the Chief Secretary to PM Narsimha Rao.

Year: 1980

Place: Tirumala (Tirupati)

Mr. Prasad was serving in Tirumala as an Executive Officer during the time in between 1978 to 1982.

On a very fine morning, a Peshkar (inner servant of Lord Balaji's pooja) called Prasad in a very restless voice.

He said :

"A group of 20 devotees have arrived and they want to offer a 108 gold coins necklace to Lord Balaji. Also they want to have darshan of Lord wearing the necklace."

Interestingly, from the beginning of Tirumala Poojan, anyone who offers ornaments to Lord and want to have darshan of Lord wearing the same ornaments, have to pay an amount equivalent to the price of the ornaments. This ritual is known as Vartana.

To simplify it friends understand this that suppose you want to offer a gold necklace with 10 lakh rupees, then you have to pay 10 lakh in additional to see Lord wearing the necklace on the same day.

This ritual was made primarily to avoid unnecessary clashes between Kings and Zamindars of ancient India who used to offer ornaments frequently.

Prasad on hearing the Peshkar's call, waited not a minute and went straight to the devotees who were offering the necklace. But he was totally in shock and in complete devotion after hearing their story.

As the head of that 20 member devotees Nagaraja Rao told Mr. Prasad without knowing that he is the top officer there, briefly:

We are family from Chikmangloor Dist. of Karnataka and I am a school teacher for over 18 years.

  • 16 years back, Lord Balaji came into my dreams and demanded a 108 coins gold necklace from me. Next morning some devotees came to my home after having darshan at Tirumala and offered me Laddu prasadam. I remembered my dream that moment but didn't focused on it.
  • On the same night, Lord Balaji came into my dream again and demanded the 108 gold coins necklace. This time I took it seriously and told the whole incident to my family the very next day.
  • My family's financial condition was very poor and we couldn't afford even a single silver coin, forget 108 gold coins necklace. We had some agriculture land but that too was barren and yielded very less. I being the only earning member make that worse.
  • At last we family decided to offer copper coin necklace with gold polish on it. But the same night Lord Balaji again appeared into my dream again and demanded a pure gold necklace.
  • Now we were confirmed. From the very next day, we skipped meal of one time and saved money. Within 6 months, we were able to make 2 gold coins.
  • Time went by and family members got into high earning jobs. Our barren land also got fertile with the time and gold necklace work caught momentum.
  • It took us 16 long years to make a thick gold chain with 108 gold coins depicting Lord Balaji and His consorts engravings.
  • On the day of completion of gold necklace, Lord Balaji appeared in my dream again and told "Necklace is ready, I am pleased! Now why don't you all family members come atop the hills at Tirumala and offer me the necklace and then have my darshan wearing it."

Lord Balaji has also instructed me in my dream that if any problem occurs, this man (showed face only) will help you.

Nagaraga Rao became silent after saying all this.

Suddenly he saw Prasad and exclaimed:

"Hey! You are the man Lord Balaji told me to get help from. I don't know who you are but I am sure you will surely help us in offering this necklace and have darshan of Lord wearing it."

Tears went down Prasad's eyes. He went into trance for a moment. Regained himself and started thinking:

  • I have no authority to dismiss a ritual running from thousands of years. But I can't break the pure faith of this family also!
  • And moreover Lord Balaji has chosen me to fulfill the desire of his devotees. What should I say to TTD committee and trust regarding necklace and Vartana fees!
  • These people can't afford a Vartana money which is atleast 2 lakh rupees. They can't even afford ticket to darshan, forgrt abhisheka seva ticket. Only money they have is to go back to their village.

Thousands of questions were made to rest when Prasad finally ordered his people that these 20 devotees are VIP guests of Tirumala Devsthanams. Treat them with utmost respect and care.

Next day was Friday. Whole family got the lifetime chance to witness the Abhisheka Darshana of Lord Balaji.

After Abhisheka, Lord Balaji was decorated with that 108 gold coin necklace which the Rao family offered.

Whole family chanted "Govinda! Govind!" in an utmost ecstacy. Tears were flowing from each and every 20 members of devotees.

Why not! It took 16 long years for this very day to come in front of them.

Prasad felt a deep solace and thanked The One and Only, The Supreme Almighty for making him a part of his play.

Later in that month, board meeting of TTD happened and when Prasad told all the board members, authorities of weaving off the Vartana, they all supported his decision and backed him which eventually resulted in changing this Vartana law for some exceptional cases.

Whenever you are in your deepest grief, saddest moment and rock bottom life, just close your eyes and remember that One and Only Supreme Almighty.

Silently whisper "Govinda! Govinda!" like a child cries for his mother only.

He will come to rescue you within a blink of an eye. I am never sure of anything more than this in my life.

This is the reason that nobody leaves empty handed after visiting Tirupati.

Jay Ram Ji Ki🙏

Me. I have gone to Tirumala probably ten times till date.

The least time it took to reach sanctum sanctorum of Tirumala was around 1.5 hours. The longest it took was around 12 hours.

For me, as an atheist/agnostic, I just love the enthusiasm of all the devotees there and chanting ‘Gobinda Gobinda’ during the entire procession. We hardly get a glimpse of the God ( 10 sec at max. unless ur the stubborn one and do not move at all) during the entire process but i just love the atmosphere here and those laddus! You don’t get those laddus anywhere in the world.

For many, its the faith that brings them there but for me, its the atmosphere. I’ve visited so many temples and travelled so many places, but the atmosphere of this place is truly amazing and a lifetime experience.

I have many many and many things to share if the topic is about Lord Balaji (I call him Srihari).

Flashback 1995, when i was just one year old. My first haircut was planned in Tirumala. My mom was carrying me on her lap in a train and she started sleeping then i slipped off from her and had a head injury and it was kind of a big one. Since i was a baby and sensitive to pain i started crying for the full journey until i see Srihari. My mom told me that the moment i enter the sanctum I was all quite and magically i haven't cried till today reason being pain (injury). Legend has blessed me with resistance to pain. (24 years met with accidents and injuries, nah i did’nt cry though)

I lived a normal life with medium level of devotion towards god like anyone else, Till 2015. We have planned a Tirumala trip again, this time something strange happened. Like any temple i was in a huge line (waiting for darshan) took almost 8 hrs for darshan. (peak season) I started mumbling this and that. why should we struggle so much just to see an idol.

Again i have been to the holy place, The sanctum (bangaru vakali) OMG I feel so relaxed all of a sudden (no tiredness from standing in queue for 8 long hrs it just vanished just like that) and i really don’t think humans have designed any word to describe that ultimate feeling in any language per se. I got after seeing the IDOL (Srihari).

I could literally feel the positive vibes all over the body, felt the internal organs, Its like time stopped for a while. I was hardly inside that room for 2 mins. felt like 30 mins for me. May be that’s how Nirvana feels. I don’t know about anyone else but i really have a connection with the Legend.

His eyes, Smile, Posture I remember everything like a photograph. I could even recollect the smell i got in that place now. (a part of my consciousness i left it there) I cannot call him Beautiful there should be a special word to describe him and it should not be used for any other occasions apart from describing Srihari. That special he is. The Supreme Lord himself has turned into a statue to save us all in this kalyuga.

So, it is obvious that there are special powers in that inner room and the idol of course. you might have visited tirumala many a times but still not feel anything. See, Bakthi is a very strange thing its not love towards god its accepting him completely without a second thought. (It is believing in him in happiest and worst times too)

The Day you are fully devoted you can see paranormal things (in a good way) going on around you which has no scientific reasoning at all. May Srihari bless everyone with the element of bakthi in life to realize greater things, to realize purpose of life, to unlock pursuit of happiness and of course to realize that legend (Srihari) is the ultimate source of energy for the mere existence of universe.

Namonarayanaya.

Proud Vaishnavam

Why is the Sri Venkateswara temple in Tirupati so famous?

Lord venkateswara at Tirumala is considered to be a swayambhu idol..... He is also considered as "kaliyugadaivam". There is a belief that the god is one of the incarnation of vishnu ie., dashavataras...but the fact is, the god is not an incarnation but actual image of lord vishnu. The main reason that the temple became more famous is because of the sri chakra yantram established below the place of hundi according to vastu by Adi Shankaracharya acts as a jana-dhana akarshana yantra(yantra that attracts riches and people).Besides that it is the only vaishnava temple that has sri chakra yantram.

There is a belief that the god is one of the incarnation of vishnu ie., dashavataras...but the fact is, the god is not an incarnation but actual image of lord vishnu. The main reason that the temple became more famous is because of the sri chakra yantram established below the place of hundi according to vastu by Adi Shankaracharya acts as a jana-dhana akarshana yantra(yantra that attracts riches and people).Besides that it is the only vaishnava temple that has sri chakra yantram.Generally it was established by him only in temples of lady gods(ammavari temples) and the temple has so many mysteries. Along with the temple, seshachalam hills are the homes of many rare species of plants and animals which made the world to recognise it.

Lives in Tirupati, Andhra Pradesh, India · Author has 1.2K answers and 2.4M answer views · 5y ·

From the pilgrims point of view, the pilgrimage to Tirupati Tirumala is a great psycho relief to them. It is sheer faith and belief of the Hindu tradition, culture and religion that make people throng at Tirumala temple of Lord Venkateswara and have ‘darshan’ at any cost and inconvenience. The other factor is that the whole of the locale of Tirumala (Kshetram) is mystic in nature. It is called kaliyuga Vaikuntam and the Lord Venkateswara is described as, Kaliyuga Prathyaksha Daivam. It is the oldest temple of Sri Vaishnavite tradition founded by Sri Ramanujacharya in 12th century.

From Tirupati-Tirumala, one has to cross seven big hills, by name, Garudadri, Vrishabadri, Anjanadri, Neeladri, Seshadri, Venkatadri and Narayanadri. Hence, Venkateswara is called, The Lord of Seven Hills.

Lord Venkateswara is also named as, Aapada mokkula vaadu (The Lord who saves from difficulties, problems and sins, if one seeks for), Vaddi Kasula Vaadu ( God who collects money with interest from devotees who don't pay their debts when their wishes or desires are fulfilled). This makes people offering him, “Niluvu Dopidi” ( Offerings to the God whatever ornaments are there on the body. They put these ornaments in the Hundi), Tonsuring their heads ( to give of their hair) in a place called Kalyana Katta, and put the money or kind in the metal container called Hundi ( gifts collection centre). Such is the procedural attachment of the pilgrims or devotees to the Lord Venkateswara of Tirumala (Tirupati).

Lord Venkateswara, an incarnation of Sri Mahavishnu, is in sequence to the Sri Rama of Tretayug, Sri Krishna of Dwapara Yug and as Lord Srinivasa (Venkateswara) in Kaliyug, aaccording to the history and chronological sequence.

Such is the sacredness associated with the Tirupati-Tirumala Ksehtram of Lord Venkateswara. The North Indians call him as Balaji, a staunch devotee of Lord Venkateswara.

Lastly, the name Venkateswara, symbolises a combination of Vaishnavite and Siva Cults, thereby brings harmony between these two sects of Hindu religion.

Hari om, you are asking a question as to : “ Why is Tirupati God so powerful?”. Hari om.

ANSWER :

  • Lord Venkateswara in Tirumala is powerful because he is the personification of Lord Shree Maha Vishnu.

Lord ShreeMaha Vishnu after the Brighu Maharshi knocking his chest in Vaikuntham, Lord caught hold of the feet of the Maharshi and entreated him instead of reprimanding.

Goddess Sree Maha lakshmi was personally present in Vaikuntham at that time and was a witness for this incident.

  • Not able to tolerate the indecence meted out to Lord Shree Maha Vishnu, Goddess Maha Lakshmi left Vaikuntham and descended to the Earth.

Lord Shree Maha Vishnu, unable to bear the loneliness caused by Sree Maha Lakshmi’s absence, came down to the earth as Sreenivasa (Sreenivasulu ).

He lived around Puttoor in Chittor District of Andhra Pradesh.

Disgusted with her suspicion, Lord petrified into a stone in Tirumala.

What's a secret behind the Tirupati Balaji temple?

Tirupati, the Home of Lord Venkateswara has long been the destination of many a newly wed couple. The temple is believed to have a particular signification for newly weds as it is believed to be place where Lord Venkateswara married Padmavathy.

An interesting tale forms the backdrop to the temple. Quarrels are not unknown between happily wed couples and the divine ones are no different. Following a spat with Lord Vishnu, Goddess Lakshmi left her heavenly abode and came down to the earth. Here she stayed in a hermitage on the banks of the Godavari.

Missing his beloved, Lord Vishnu went to search

Tirupati, the Home of Lord Venkateswara has long been the destination of many a newly wed couple. The temple is believed to have a particular signification for newly weds as it is believed to be place where Lord Venkateswara married Padmavathy.

An interesting tale forms the backdrop to the temple. Quarrels are not unknown between happily wed couples and the divine ones are no different. Following a spat with Lord Vishnu, Goddess Lakshmi left her heavenly abode and came down to the earth. Here she stayed in a hermitage on the banks of the Godavari.

Missing his beloved, Lord Vishnu went to search of her and this search brought him to earth. Ultimately his quest brought him to the Seshadri hills where he stopped to rest in an anthill. Upset by the separation between Vishnu and Lakshmi, Lord Brahma and Lord Shiva decided to intervene. Taking the guise of a cow and a calf they went to live at the place of a Chola king.

The cowherd took them everyday to graze in the Seshadri hills where the cow would secretly visit the anthill where Vishnu was living without sustenance. Emptying her milk, the cow would then return to the palace.

The cowherd was angry as the cow never yielded any milk to him. He watched movements carefully and his explorations brought him to the anthill. In trying to ascertain what lay beneath the anthill, he struck it with an axe thus injuring Vishnu on the forehead.

In search of herbs to heal the wound, Lord Vishnu wandered far and wide. His wanderings brought him to the Shrine of Sri Varahaswamy - the third incarnation of Vishnu as a boar. Here, he sought permission to stay, but Varahaswamy wanted a rental to be paid; Vishnu pleaded that he was poor now and needed rent free accommodation. To reciprocate this gesture of goodwill, he said he would tell his devotees to worship Varahaswamy before they worshipped him. The contract sealed, Vishnu built a hermitage and lived there waited on by a devotee, Vakuladevi who looked after him like a mother. In a nearby kingdom ruled King Akasha Rajan. Childless for many years, he had one day found a beautiful baby girl sleeping on a golden lotus in a golden box while ploughing the fields. He had named her Padmavathy. A beautiful and accomplished girl, Padmavathy had been granted a boon in her earlier birth that she would be married to Lord Vishnu. One day, Vishnu, who had been renamed Srinivasan by his devotee and foster mother Vakuladevi, went hunting in the forest. His wandering led him to a garden with a pond. Srinivasan was thirsty and tired. After drinking from the pond, he rested in the shade of a tree. Soon the soft singing of Padmavathy who was dancing in the garden with her companions roused him. He was stunned by her beauty and drawn to her. She too seemed to be drawn to him, but the angry attendants thinking him a mere hunter drove him away.

Depressed and unhappy he poured his troubles out to Vakuladevi. Now for the first time, he revealed to her who he really was and also told her the story of Padmavathy.

In the meanwhile, Padmavathy was dreaming of Srinivasa. She had no idea who he really was and knew that her parents would never let her be married to a hunter.

Srinivasa urged Vakuladevi to approach Padmavathy's father, Akasha Raja, with the marriage proposal. In the meanwhile he disguised himself as a soothsayer and went to the court of Akasha Raja. There, he assured Padmavathy that the hunter she had fallen in love with was no ordinary man but the Lord and told her that the worries would soon be over. Padmavathy too poured out her heart to her parents. At about the same time, Vakuladevi arrived with the marriage proposal. After consulting with the sages Akasha Raja accepted the proposal and invited Srinivasa to attend the wedding on Friday, the 10th day of Vaikasi.

Srinivasa now had arrangements to make. He sought a loan of one crore and 14 lakh coins of gold from Kubera and had Viswakarma, the divine architect create heavenly surroundings in the Seshadri hills.

The day of the wedding arrived, Lord Srinivasa was bathed in holy waters and dressed in jeweled ornaments befitting a royal bride groom. Then he set off in a procession for the court of Akasha Raja. There Padmavathy waited radiant in her beauty. Srinivasa was hailed with an arthi and led to the marriage hall. There the queen and King washed his feet while sage Vasishta chanted the Vedic mantras. Soon the wedding was over and it was time for Padmavathy to take leave of her parents.

Together, they lived for all eternity while Goddess Lakshmi, understanding the commitments of Lord Vishnu, chose to live in his heart forever.

Tirupati, today, stands as a special place, commemorating the marriage between the two. Everyday, a kalyana utsavam celebrates the divine union in a celebration that stretches to eternity. Even today, during the Brahmotsavam at the temple, turmeric, kumkum and a sari are sent from the temple to Tiruchanur, the abode of Padmavathy. In fact Tirupati is rarely visited without paying a visit to Tiruchanur.

In the light of this background, it has become the favored destination of many newly wed couples who pray for a happy wedding - a wedding like that of Srinivasa and Padmavathy.

What are some unbelievable facts about Lord Sri Venkateswara Swamy in Tirumala?

It’s an amazing miracle which occurred almost three and half decades ago in the holy abode of Lord Venkateswara at the Tirumala Tirupati Temple.

The miracle occurred in the holy temple of Tirumala on the midnight of 7th November 1979. At that time, the whole of Tirumala was in a deep sleep. The whole of temple shrine was filled with absolute silence.

It was at the dark hour when the miracle occurred suddenly and took the entire Tirumala hill shrine by shock and surprise.

The huge bronze bells that were hanging in front of Lord Venkateswara in the Sanctum Sanctorum of the Tirumala Tirupati Temple

It’s an amazing miracle which occurred almost three and half decades ago in the holy abode of Lord Venkateswara at the Tirumala Tirupati Temple.

The miracle occurred in the holy temple of Tirumala on the midnight of 7th November 1979. At that time, the whole of Tirumala was in a deep sleep. The whole of temple shrine was filled with absolute silence.

It was at the dark hour when the miracle occurred suddenly and took the entire Tirumala hill shrine by shock and surprise.

The huge bronze bells that were hanging in front of Lord Venkateswara in the Sanctum Sanctorum of the Tirumala Tirupati Temple started to ring on their own without anyone touching them.

The waves of the heavy metal sound rose across the whole of Tirumala Hill Shrine.

The huge sound of the Bronze bells shocked the security staff, the police, the pilgrims, the officials, the temple staff, and the Purohits. They woke up startled and came running to the main Temple.

They could not believe their eyes how the huge bronze bells could ring on their own, without anyone touching them.

It was even more surprising as the bells continued to ring in that fashion for about five minutes and then stopped on their own.

It was a miracle for all those gathered there; an unbelievably true state.

It was mysterious, miraculous, and amazing.

“Out of the world”

By out of the world I don't refer easy, luxurious and fulling all my desires but it has touched my soul. This is my personal experience.

I deliberately took the longest queue to Dharshan. I wanted to travel like the rest of the people, I wanted to feel like I am nothing in this world. A sense of humbleness grew within me when I saw so many people. The Ego which grew upon me, got lifted in the grace of god.

It makes me think, what are they praying for and who are they praying for. Have you ever asked god for something from the deepest and sincerest place from your heart. My faith in god got stronger and reiterated.

I also tonsured/ shaved my head. Came out of the tonsuring hall and looked at myself in the mirror, people would say you don’t look like yourself, but I could see myself clearly, bare and naked. Shaving your head is a spiritual experience. I recommend doing it.

There was a lot of waiting. Where people are contained in a hanger like refugees. It is good place to introspect.

Finally those few seconds of pure joy when you get to see lord Vishnu. Beware to not close your eyes while you pray, as you will be pushed out by the time you open your eyes.

PS: Don’t you forget to take back the ladoos, which is what is the benefit for people back at home.

How often you visit Tirupati Tirumala? What pushes you to visit it again and again?

Hare Krishna!

Till now I just visited 3 to 4 times. That's it. Even I don't know anything when I visited. I mean I was his devotee only, but don't know much glories of Tirumala or TiruVenkatapathi. But, even though I loved my trip then too.

There are number of devotees who visit yearly, twice a year, etc. Though I didn't visit like that, want to answer this.🙏

Ok, now what's there which isn't encouraging anyone to visit that lovely divine place again and again.!!!!!!!! EVERYTHING, exactly everything we see there encourages us not to go from there and to visit again and again.

Sri Venkateswara swamy:

We can see him for 10 to 20 seconds there because of huge queue and number of devotees. Even we see him for some seconds, his murthy attracts us from our core of the heart in that way that we forget everything. (And this isn'tjust attraction but, takes us to true love and devotion which bestowsus salvation too😊)Yes, I heard this from many devotees who visited Tirumala. They go to ask many things and bestow them good life, etc., But, when they go in front of the Garbhalyam, the second we see him, we forget everything. Just see his murthy. And the next second having his darsan we just firstly, ask him for Punardarsanam. Hope nothing more than that. After sometime, we ask him to fulfill our wishes. But, that second we see him, we forget everything and just want to see him.

I'm not able to stop if I'm just imagining that seeing him there. Then, imagine, the feelings of the devotees who really visited.🙏🙏🙏

Mercy of Sri Alamelmanga Thayar:

Sri Padmavathi devi blesses us everything best with her darsan and requests her consort to protect us, his devotees. After her darsan and telling our problems to her, we feel relaxed as if our problem is solved. We wish to see our Maa more number of times. No words for me to describe her vatsalyam who is Vatsalyam herself.

Govinda Govinda:

This is the another one with which we'll forget everything. Any time you go, may be morning or evening, any season, any month, you'll surely hear Govinda Govinda!! Yedukondalavaada Venkataramana Govinda Govinda!!!!!!! always in Tirumala 24/7. We too will tell Govinda Govinda! without our interference only. That's just a magic. We also experience divine feeling when all the devotees are telling Govinda Govinda.🥰

Utsavas/Sevas:

This is another thing which we can never forget. His vaibhav in different utsavas (Nityothsavas like Kalyanotsavam, Dolotsavam, Thomala seva, etc. and many other pakshotsava, masotsava and varshikothsavas) can’t be forgotten by anyone. His murthies like mula murthy, utsava, snapana and all others and even Tirumala will be decorated beautifully with flowers. And for seeing that even 1,000 eyes aren’t sufficient. His murthy with a beautiful smile and decorated with flowers which stoles full of our concentration on him.

Beautiful nature:

The hills are beautiful and divine. Greenery, plants, waterfalls, all encourages us to visit again. Natural beauties/monuments are lot in number. Just visit the temple and at least some visiting places there, you'll surely know and experience the beauty of nature. And cleanliness is also a point there when we talk about Tirumala. I don't remember exactly but, it was pointed out by Government too for it's cleanliness and maintenance inspite of thousands of devotees visit to there and number of people residence. It's sooo much clean all the time🙏

Peace:

Yes, even though we hear Govinda Govinda always, we never get bored and just want to hear again and again. If we hear anything continuously, that too, in louder voice, we scold others to stop nonsense. But, it's never like that here. And the peace we experience while hearing is unmatchable. We experience a divine feeling just after stepping on that beautiful hill.😍 That's the power there. We forget all our problems and enjoy peace there🙏

Sri Vaikuntam:

Tirumala is no less to Sri Vaikuntam. Every being on that hill is divine. They are great sages, devotees of Sri Vishnu. When we step on that hill which is divine itself there’s nothing surprise if we experience unmatchable divine feeling. That divine experience calls us again.

Laddu:

Don’t take it silly as I included it. It’s a fortune to eat Prasadam that too Laddu of Tirumala. Even that calls us for his darsan and for prasadam. How can I forget about Tirupati Laddu while talking about Tirumala and it’s glories. Even patent rights were given to Tirumala Laddu. It’s soo much popular and divine.

And by these experiences our love towards Srinivasa Paramathma increases unconditionally which saves us from maya and shows the path of Moksham which is the goal of every human.

These are some of the reasons which encourages and pushes everyone to visit that divine place again and again.

Om Namo Venkatesaya!!!

How did Tamil Nadu lose Tirupati to Andhra Pradesh?

Tirupati has always been a Telugu majority town since very ancient times. During the partition of Madras Presidency, Tirupati was indeed a Telugu majority city. Hence it was given to Andhra Pradesh. The demand for Tirupati was made by some Tamil politicians mainly to counter Telugu people who demanded Chennai should be given to Andhra. The reason claimed by Telugus was “ Chennapattanam (chennai) was given to the British East India company in 1650 by the then Telugu rulers of this region”.

Tirupati has always been a Telugu majority town since very ancient times. During the partition of Madras Presidency, Tirupati was indeed a Telugu majority city. Hence it was given to Andhra Pradesh. The demand for Tirupati was made by some Tamil politicians mainly to counter Telugu people who demanded Chennai should be given to Andhra. The reason claimed by Telugus was “ Chennapattanam (chennai) was given to the British East India company in 1650 by the then Telugu rulers of this region”.

Tiruttani had 50% Telugu and 50% Tamil population was given to Tamilnadu. Andhra’s famous leader Sarvepalli Radha Krishna was born in Tiruttani. Hosur was predominantly Telugu majority, but still given to Tamilnadu. Even today Hosur has significant Telugu population. Bellary was once a Telugu dominant city but given to Karnataka. Chennai is just 50 Km away from the Andhra border. Vellore is just yards away from Andhra.

The native Tamil population in Tirupati were mostly the priests who used to work in the Temple. Some people claim that the inscriptions in Tirupati temple are in Tamil, but they need to understand that the Temple has inscriptions in all major South Indian languages (Tamil +Telugu +Kannada ) not just Tamil . Some people even claim that the root word ‘Tiru' in Tirupati is a Tamil word. I don't know about that, but the earlier name of Tirupati was Govindaraja Puram, it was renamed to Tirupati only after the arrival of Sri Ramanujacharya. It was Sri Krishnadeva Raya who renamed the town Govindaraja Puram to Tirupati because his samsthanam poets had Tamil alvars as well. Alvars are the vaishnava sect of Tamil, he changed the name inorder to honour them.

Otherwise, Tirupati has always been a Telugu town.

Tirupati Balaji is very dear and sacred to Telugu people.

Jai Srinivasa.

Namo Venkatesha.

Dear,

If you notice well you barely get a few seconds in the sanctum sanctorum of Tirumala temple. Lord Balaji is way inside and the few seconds of glimpse itself puts us in an aura of bliss for many days or months. That is because of the Tirupati temple itself on the hill top of Tirumala which is considered as Chandra Stalam. A place of moon, which is a predominant power house of mind. What is the story behind Tirupati, and why is it so popular in India? Are there any divine reasons for the huge amount of people visiting it?

For much over 1 billion Hindu population this temple holds a lot of significance. Mahavishnu was manifested as Sri Venkateshwara Swami , the benevolent deity who took up the permanant residence in Tirumala .

A sacred chamber known as Garbha griha is where the principal deity Sri Venkateshwara Swami stands tall presiding at a height of 8 feet.

Storyline

Once sage Brighu wanted to find out who is the supreme one among the Hindu triad. Not being satisfied with the hospitality given by Brahma and Shiva, the sage went to Vaikunta and kicked Lord Vishnu on the chest to grab his attention.

Since Vishnu’s consort Lakshmi was residing in the chest of the Lord, she felt insulted and left Vaikunta to the earth. Lord Vishnu came to the earth in search of Lakshmi who had taken birth in the family of a king in the name Padmavati and married her on the Tirupati hills and got enshrined there forever to save the people of the Kali age.

The construction of Tirupati Balaji temple

It was endured in the 9th century by the Pallava dynasty. In the history of the temple, much of its wealth and size was gained during the reign of the Vijayanagara rulers who poured gold and diamonds into the treasury of the temple. When the emperor Krishnadevaraya visited the temple in 1517, he ordered for the gilding of the inner roof of the temple.

The rulers of the Kingdom of Mysore and the Gadwal Samsthan visited the temple regularly and contributed so much valuables.

The popularity of the temple

It is believed among the devotees that if we seek blessing from Sri Venkateshwara swami at Tirupati temple their wishes are fullifed .

This is the richest temple on the earth with overwhelming contributions and donations from the public and the most famous pilgrim destination on the earth attracting the greatest number of people on any given day.

Source :

Documentary on Inside Tirumala temple by National Geographic channel

How many kgs of kumkua and pasupu are required to put for steps at Tirupati?

It depend on which way you are choosing.. There are two ways to reach Tirumula by walk..

  1. Sri vari mettu dari — 2.1kms — 2388 steps
  2. Alipiri dari — 9.1 kms — 3540 steps

If you choose first one then approximately 2–3 kgs are required as distance covered is less but there will be more steps with no normal road way.

If you second option then approximately 4–5 kgs is required as distance covered is more and also there are more steps as well.. In this root there is mokalla parvatam mettlu where you require more pasupu and kumkuma..

It's better to carry more than less even if it's left out you can take bac

How can I do puja in Tirupati Temple? I have listened so much rumors of Pandit of temple for entering fee.

There is no fee for having His darshan, if you opt for Sarva darsanam queue. No priest nor employee stands at the entrance of the temple to charge money from you. There is no cash counter for Sarva darsanam either.

You cannot perform any personalized puja to the Lord of Tirumala. Nor can you get it done in your name by any priest there. Your simple business is - to go there, have His darshan and come out silently. All the Pujas (called sevas) are done at Tirumala according to a pre-set daily programme as per the Vaikhaanasa aagaama by the designated priests whom devotees cannot approach personally. They are among the highest-paid employees of the TTD and do not crave for anything from the devotees who number about 50,000 a day.

There are group services to the Lord for which you need to buy a ticket from the TTD counter in your name and attend the service in a group of devotees. 4 - 6 people are allowed per ticket. Now these tickets need to be booked online several days in advance.

So there is no question of you being charged by the Pundits.

Which is the best month to visit the Tirupati Balaji Temple?

November to February is the pleasant and ideal time to visit Tirupati Balaji Temple. During this period of time the minimum temperature usually doesn't dip below 15°C, keeping the weather comfortable. You only feel a bit cold during night but to keep you warm you need light woolens at night. From March to June: Summers in Tirupati are hot and humid.

What is very special about Tirupathi/Tirumala?

One very special feature about major Hindu temples is the deep faith by which the Hindus connect the geographical features around those temples with symbolism from the purana-s. Tirupati is one such instance.

It is well known that Lord Vishnu is believed to be reclining on the great serpent, Ananta or Adishesha. Analogous to that, the entire Nallamala mountain range of about 430 kms, at the southern tip of which is located the Tirumala temple with Lord Vishnu as Sri Venkateshwara, is visualised as as this great serpent:

The cluster of Seven Hills in this mountain range, upon which the temple sta

One very special feature about major Hindu temples is the deep faith by which the Hindus connect the geographical features around those temples with symbolism from the purana-s. Tirupati is one such instance.

It is well known that Lord Vishnu is believed to be reclining on the great serpent, Ananta or Adishesha. Analogous to that, the entire Nallamala mountain range of about 430 kms, at the southern tip of which is located the Tirumala temple with Lord Vishnu as Sri Venkateshwara, is visualised as as this great serpent:

The cluster of Seven Hills in this mountain range, upon which the temple stands, is visualised as the seven hoods of the serpent, Ananta. Three of them can be seen in this picture:

Isn’t that ingenious?
